email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out with a freight offer for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a vessel available, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 250 meters. The laycan is October 15-20. The starting freight rate is $52.50 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the offer. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit high compared to the current market. Would you consider $50.75 per metric ton? Looking forward to your reply. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your response. I understand your concern about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $51.25 per metric ton. This is our best and final offer. Let me know if this works for you. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. We can accept $51.25 per metric ton, provided the laycan remains October 15-20. Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that the rate works for you. The laycan is confirmed for October 15-20. The demurrage rate is $20,000 per day, pro rata. I’ll send over the charter party agreement shortly. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the confirmation. We’ll review the charter party agreement once received. Looking forward to finalizing this deal. Best, John
